author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A dazzling portrayal of the Roaring Twenties, 'The Great Gatsby' dives into themes of wealth, ambition, love, and illusion through the tragic story of Jay Gatsby and his pursuit of the elusive Daisy Buchanan.

author: Harper Lee
review: A powerful and compassionate narrative that confronts racial injustice, 'To Kill a Mockingbird' explores the moral growth of Scout Finch as her father defends a wrongly accused Black man in a deeply divided Southern town.

author: George Orwell
review: Orwell’s chilling dystopia depicts a totalitarian regime where Big Brother watches every move, rewriting history and suppressing truth. A profound warning on the dangers of authoritarianism and the erosion of freedom.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: This coming-of-age classic follows Holden Caulfield through a raw and cynical exploration of teenage alienation, rebellion, and the struggle to find meaning in a seemingly 'phony' adult world.

author: Jane Austen
review: A brilliant commentary on society and relationships, Austen's novel mixes wit and romance as Elizabeth Bennet navigates family expectations, class, and love with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A rich fantasy adventure, 'The Hobbit' follows Bilbo Baggins as he leaves his quiet life to join a quest full of dragons, dwarves, and courage. A prelude to the epic Lord of the Rings trilogy.

bookName: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
review: The magical journey begins as Harry Potter discovers his true heritage, attends Hogwarts School, and confronts the dark legacy of Lord Voldemort. A tale of friendship, courage, and destiny.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: A poetic and spiritual journey about following your dreams, 'The Alchemist' chronicles Santiago’s quest for treasure and self-discovery across the Egyptian desert. A modern philosophical fable.

author: Paula Hawkins
review: A gripping psychological thriller, this novel follows Rachel, whose daily train commute turns into a dark mystery as she becomes entangled in a missing person case and questions her own reality.

author: Markus Zusak
review: Narrated by Death, this hauntingly beautiful novel tells the story of Liesel, a young girl in Nazi Germany, who finds solace and resistance in stealing books and sharing stories in dark times.

bookName: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
review: A sweeping and thought-provoking history of the human species, 'Sapiens' explores how Homo sapiens rose to dominate the Earth, examining biology, culture, economics, and future challenges.

author: Tara Westover
review: A deeply moving memoir about resilience and transformation, 'Educated' recounts Tara Westover’s escape from an isolated, survivalist family in Idaho to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.
